qas.question: How many questions does the SASO contain?
What do six of the questions asses?
What do the other six questions asses?

answers.text: four assess sexual behavior, and two assess sexual orientation identity

qas.question: What questions corresponds to the homosexual ones?
How are the results simplified when using the SASO?

answers.text: into four summaries that look specifically at responses that correspond to either homosexuality, heterosexuality, bisexuality or asexuality.

context: The SASO consists of <a0_0>12<a0_0/> questions. Six of these questions assess <a1_0>sexual attraction<a1_0/>, <a2_0>four assess sexual behavior, and two assess sexual orientation identity<a2_0/>. For each question on the scale that measures homosexuality there is a corresponding question that measures <a3_0>heterosexuality<a3_0/> giving six matching pairs of questions. Taken all together, the six pairs of questions and responses provide a profile of an individual's sexual orientation. However, results can be further simplified <a4_0>into four summaries that look specifically at responses that correspond to either homosexuality, heterosexuality, bisexuality or asexuality.
